cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to slow, turn north and finally northeast hugging the upper-Texas coastline into Louisiana.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay/Freeport area

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA (includes Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay and the southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (40–50 mph with higher gusts) likely Monday afternoon through early Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible in Galveston Bay and along the upper-Texas coast producing coastal flooding in and around Texas City.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals to 20 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
